podcast_summary: The Franklin Expedition was a disastrous Arctic exploration led by John Franklin in the mid-19th century. The expedition aimed to map the Northwest Passage, but all 129 crew members, including Franklin himself, perished. The fate of the expedition remained a mystery for many years, with various search missions launched to find them. In recent years, the wreckage of the expedition ships, the Erebus and the Terror, has been discovered. There are various theories as to why the expedition failed, including bad luck with weather, underpreparedness, and the possible ingestion of lead-contaminated tinned food. It is also known that some crew members resorted to cannibalism in a desperate attempt to survive. The story of the Franklin Expedition continues to captivate and intrigue people to this day.
podcast_guest: Sarah Wayne Callies (born June 1, 1977) is an American actress. She is known for starring as Sara Tancredi in Fox's Prison Break, Lori Grimes in AMC's The Walking Dead, and more recently, as Birdie Nicolletti in ABC's The Company You Keep. She has also starred as Katie Bowman in USA Network's Colony and Robin Perry in NBC's Council of Dads and has had film roles in Whisper (2007), Blac Gold (2011), and The Show (2017).
podcast_highlights: The Franklin expedition was an Arctic exploration mission in the mid-19th century that ended in tragedy. Led by Captain John Franklin, the crew was tasked with navigating the uncharted Northwest Passage, but their ships, the HMS Erebus and HMS Terror, became trapped in ice and the entire crew perished. The exact cause of their deaths remains a mystery, but theories suggest a combination of factors including extreme weather conditions, underpreparedness, lead poisoning from improperly sealed canned food, and possible cannibalism due to dire circumstances. In recent years, the wrecks of the ships have been discovered, providing new insights into the expedition.
